body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

p.note:
Commonwealth
vs
Lewis W. Sale --
R. S. Hall
scre facias
Judgment agant L. W. Sale in the Jef Cir. Court for $400. March the 4. 1865

body.p:
Your Excellency's petitioner, Lewis W Sale, respectfully represents that he is a citizen of Kentucky residing in Louisville, that on the 28th day of September, 1864, on R. S Hall, being under arrest in said city on the charge of grand larceny, Your petitioner, actuated and induced solely by the belief that the said Hall was innocent of said accusation, signed his name as securety to a bond for four hundred dollars, taken by the chancellor of the Louisville Chancery Court, for the appearance of the said Hall at the October term of the Jefferson Circuit Court, and thereafter the said Hall failing to appear at said term, the amnt of said bond was declaired forfeited and a writ of 'scire facias" issued against said Hall and your petitioner, upon which a judgment has been rendered against your petitioner for the sum of four hundred dollars, said Hall not being found; and your petitioner further represents that he is a poor man, with a large family, dependent upon his daily exertions and that the payment of so large a sum of money, will subject him to serious inconvenience and great privation wherefore he earnestly petitions your Excellency to release him from
the payment of said judgment same and except or so much thereof as may be coming to the attorney for the commonwealth
We, the undersigned, join with the petitioner Lewis W. Sale in the prayer, of his, the foregoing petition

Martin Bijur
Atty for Commonwealth for that term
I hope the Governer will grant the prayer of the petition
J R Page Scty of state

will please find enclosed $200 fee for remission provided the Govr should see proper to remit and when done will please send the same to Mr Louis Sale, or James P Chambers Clerk of our circuit court or to myself Mr Page will also please find enclosed three Briefs which belong to the office of the Court of appeals which he will do the favor to
deliver to Mr Bolling, with my compliments & thanks for his kindness & prompt attention to all matters
Please say to his excellency for me that the party for whom Sale went bail, according to my best information was a volunteer & not a Substitute
Yr prompt attention will much oblige

Yrs truly
J R Dupuy
Com' atty

The certified copies of the bills passed at the last session were duly rec'd Enclosed please find application for a requisition upon the Gov of the State of Tennessee Please attend to it & send down to me appointing William Hipwell & Thomas Garrity agents

Jas R Page Esqr
asst secty of State

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Lewis Sale
$400 --
Forfeiture
14th Mch 1865
